p: TAG transesterification consists of a succession of three reversible reactions, each one releasing a FA ester molecule. TAGs are firstly converted to diglycerides (DAGs) that are in turn converted to monoglycerides (MAGs) and finally to glycerol [ 69, 70]. Overall, three fatty acid ethyl esters (FAEEs) and one glycerol unit are produced from one TAG ( Figure 4). About 10 w/w% of the total product is constituted of glycerol that can be purified and converted into value-added chemicals [ 15].
